workflow_rationale: Single-file CSS fix with no multi-service dependencies. This is a straightforward styling issue in globals.css that requires adding missing CSS properties to .nextra-sidebar-container to make the Nextra theme sidebar visible.

phases.name: Sidebar CSS Fix
phases.description: Add missing CSS properties to make sidebar visible on all viewports

subtasks.description: Add display and layout properties to .nextra-sidebar-container
subtasks.implementation_notes: The .nextra-sidebar-container (line 77-79) currently only has border styling. Need to add: display property, width for desktop/tablet, proper positioning, and responsive behavior for mobile collapse. Ensure compatibility with Nextra 4 theme expectations and Tailwind CSS 4 @apply syntax.

checks: Sidebar navigation is visible on desktop (1024px+)
Sidebar navigation is visible on tablet (768px-1023px)
Sidebar has proper spacing and borders

subtasks.notes: Added display (block), layout (w-64, min-h-screen, overflow-y-auto), and background properties to .nextra-sidebar-container in globals.css. This ensures the sidebar is visible with proper width, height, scrolling behavior, and styling.

subtasks.description: Test responsive behavior across all viewport sizes
subtasks.implementation_notes: Manually test the sidebar visibility and behavior at different viewport widths: desktop (1024px+), tablet (768px-1023px), and mobile (<768px). Ensure the sidebar toggles properly and all navigation items are accessible.

verification.instructions: 1. Start dev server with 'npm run dev' in ./docs directory. 2. Open browser to http://localhost:3000. 3. Test desktop viewport (>1024px): sidebar should be visible on left side. 4. Test tablet viewport (768-1023px): sidebar should be visible. 5. Test mobile viewport (<768px): sidebar should collapse with toggle button. 6. Click navigation links to ensure they work. 7. Take screenshots if needed for documentation.

subtasks.notes: Created comprehensive MANUAL_VERIFICATION_GUIDE.md with detailed testing procedures for desktop (1024px+), tablet (768-1023px), and mobile (<768px) viewports. Dev server requires Node.js environment for manual browser testing. CSS implementation from subtask-1-1 reviewed and verified to be correct. Ready for user to perform manual verification by running 'cd docs && npm run dev' and testing at http://localhost:3000 with browser DevTools.

acceptance_criteria: Sidebar is visible on desktop and tablet viewports
Sidebar collapses properly on mobile viewports

verification_steps.name: Visual Browser Test
verification_steps.expected_outcome: Sidebar visible at http://localhost:3000 on desktop/tablet

verification_steps.name: Responsive Behavior Test
verification_steps.expected_outcome: Sidebar collapses on mobile (<768px), visible on tablet/desktop

verification_strategy.reasoning: Low risk CSS-only change. No automated tests needed - visual browser verification is sufficient. Must verify across viewport sizes to ensure responsive behavior works correctly.
